column4: does anyone know how to get a package removed with its dependencies (meaning the stuff that was installed with it. i.e. kde-core gets rid of everything kde-core depended on)?
if you do that recursively you end up removing EVERYTHING.
well, find the packages it depended on that aren't depended on by other packages.
I had a script that calculated that on mandrake using rpm/urpmi.  I don't know apt/deb well enough. :)
